title: Great Hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Wonderful hotel!
review: We wanted to do a quick stop over for 2 days before heading over to cappadicia. For what we paid, it is a super hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet. Breakfast was great too.  Thank you  AJ and Rani England

title: Nice place
review: What a great hotel! Small boutique hotel in a great location. The staff were so helpful and lovely and friendly. Our room was perfect. We had a different room the first night which wasn't so nice but it was because we arrived very late and were moved the next morning to a room next door. I am guessing that theres some renovation going on hence the first room being not as nice. Air conditioning was working fine so no problems there. Breakfast was gorgeous! Lovely fresh made omelettes every morning prepared by a great lady!..along with an array of fruits/pastries/juices/egg/toast and everything else. And the view was very special. Theres a terrace open to all at all hours and we had a few lovely nights up there watching the moon rise...just spectacular! Location was right beside all the sights and walking distance to tram/train to everywhere else. Tours arranged and airport transfers too by reception. Thank you to the whole team there that made our holiday so enjoyable!…

title: Great! Отлично!
review: Upsides There was the best breakfast I tried in Turkey. The room was nice and clean. There was a water dispenser with cold and hot water in the lobby.  Downsides Only cold water in the sink, but there was hot water in the shower.

title: strong recommending hotel
review: We were here from 28.04.2018 to 04.05.2018. Hotel has got good location, good stuff, good breakfast, right rooms. I advise you this hotel, this is the best offer for this price. Сообщение для русских: отличный отель, хороший персонал, прекрасная терраса с видом на море, простой но хороший завтрак, великолепное расположение!

title: Very bad hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Great location, but that´s all
review: I boked this hotel for 12 nights. When i arrived the rooms was terrible and the door was broken the lamp was have working. The phone didn't work and the rooms was small. The mirror was broken. The bed sheets had hole in it. The power socket was broken. And the hotel was old. And the pictures dose not fit the reality. When i told them about these problems they said we will fix it. But where were they before we arrived. So i had a problem with them. And i had to cancle the reservation and pay a fine because the room was non refundable. And by the way the reception gay was good but the owner was a very bad person.

title: Good location and best breakfast during our trip
review: The hotel has really prefect location, with very friendly and helpfull staff, the price is for that location average, the room was really small, with very old demaged furniture, bathroom was quite dirty, there was a terrible smell in whole hotel, the breakfest served at the roof top is rich, but not very tasty, I won´t reccomend this hotel, I don't know the standard for Istambul, we were here for the firt time, but if this hotel was in Europe, it would be really expensive for value youľl get, definitly can´t reccomend.

title: Very good
review: Very nice welcome on arrival with quick check in times. The rooms are a bit old and could use some improvement but it was sufficient to act as a clean place to sleep and explore the city from its great location. The breakfast was great with daily home made pastries with different condiments and was the best we encountered during our trip at different budget hotels.

title: Bad experience!
review: At first very nice welcome, staff was very funny, helpfull. Room was clean, comfortable bed, maybe bath was quite small, but everything was fine! If I had a chance to travel to Istanbul once again, I would choose this hotel. By the way, the location of hotel is perfect.

title: Lovely and very good location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: FANTASTIC
review: Very good welcome,excellent service & convenience ! We have very fun the stuff are very friendly and cooperative. Is the best location for me because every thing are close.Morning was very diverse and do more special appearance on the tarrace.

title: The BEST customer service that I've ever experienced.
review: This hotel had a fantastic location, fantastic staff,  the rooms were very clean and very comfortable. they just make you feel home. A terrace for breakfast with the mosque view si really great.  The Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sophia Basilica Cistern Grand Bazzar were just 10 min away with walking. great restaurants and great caffe bar in the area. i stayed for 4 days and absloutely would choose the same hotel in my next visit. A big thank you to the owner Sercan who was very helpful in everything we needed.  Great Job.

title: Lovely & Central
review: An absolutely faultless stay. I arrived in Istanbul at 10.00 AM, and headed to the hotel to dump my luggage as check-in was only at 1.00 PM. The owner kindly allowed me to check-in early, upgrading my room and telling me to help myself to breakfast. First impressions speak the loudest and working in the hospitality industry myself, I was immediately impressed. The next day my bank card was blocked due to fraudulent activity, resulting in the owner being very helpful and calming, arranging airport transfer and even offering me some money from his own pocket. He really went above and beyond. Not only is the service faultless, staff friendly and pleasant, location serene yet central, atmosphere warm and inviting, hotel majestically furnished, rates extremely reasonable - the…

title: Super location and service
review: Very close to many attractions & all historical places and many restaurants around. Sorrounding area is calm and quite.. Terrace for breakfast and night views is really great. If not looking for luxury but relax and calm destination then you will have a good choice with Apex hotel.

title: Fabulous place,fabulous staff,perfect location!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Friendly and well located
review: Fantastic location, within 5 minutes of walking distance to Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, 15 min walk to Grand Bazar, 5 min walk to Bascilia Cistern...loads of great Restaraunts, Cafes, shopping places, metro links all within minutes of walking. Also few minutes walk to Sea if you fancy a stroll. Great Shisha gardens around. Apart from the location, Sercan, the owner, is a fantastic host. A truly great guy with a good sense of humour, who cannot do enough for you. We travelled in a car( which was rather an expensive make) Sercan drove with me to different car parks to find a secure parking for me. When we weren't satisfied with the security of these car parks he very kindly moved his own car and gave me his space in front of the hotel. Gave us lots of valuable advice…

title: Great location ,friendly people
review: Very friendly and helpful staff, location very close to Blue Mosque and other sites, very nice breakfast, roof terrace. Was told that the owner was taking back charge after having outsourced management of hotel for a couple of years with bad results. Wants to bring back of the level-quality of service, and I believe they are on the right track! :)  Rooms were small and in need of a little love though.  They've already done some, but still needs a bit.

title: Great location, great staff, super breakfast for super value
review: Apex hotel is a nice hotel with small rooms, no elevator, no water to drink in the rooms, you have to buy from outside but great location , near to restaurants,supermarkers, blue mosque, agia sophia, underground city and the sultan palace transformed to a museum. The breakfast is good not a lot of variety but it s delicious and clean . The most important is that they are so friendly and helpful specially to the kids.  The last night we wanted pizza delivery and the night shift guy sergent ( i don't know if i write it right) helped us . he was so nice calling from his own phone to pizza hut that was closed then to dominos pizza and came up to our room to take the order . Thank you so much Mr. Sergent .   Not to mention that the wifi is very good and the hotel is very clean

title: Mcquaids
review: This is a small little hotel run now by the family who owns the place so they are investing more into it. The owner, a young Turkish guy from Holland is very friendly and helpful, taking care of everything that you need without pushing you to take one tour or other. This place has the best breakfast we had in our entire Turkey trip in a rooftop cafe with a nice view which encourages travelers to talk among each other - we made several long conversation with Canadian, Pakistani, Iranians families staying at the hotel at breakfast time. Only downside is that the rooms are small but this is the most prime area of Istanbul, right behind the Blue Mosque so it is reasonable for the price. We had some disturbance on the first night due to whirring of aircon from other room but it was…

title: Very Welcoming
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: clean and cosy
review: Apex Hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Palace..... Owner and staff are super nice. Free WiFi and breakfast on rooftop terrace included. A taste of real Istanbul.  Had a great stay.

title: A warm welcoming place to be
review: Apex hotel is located in the heart of Istanbul offering you time saving trips to the main tourist's attractions such as SultanAhmet sq. Blue mosque, AyaSofia, grand bazar, arasta bazar, very close to metro transport, .....etc.  it is a renovated hotel clean and cosy, with picturesque terrace on which an inter-continantal amazing breakfast is served every morning to satisfy every diet and taste , with very friendly manager and staff who speak Eng. and give you useful info about the town and transport routs.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Situated near the Blu Mosque in the heart of Istanbul it's a fantastic place to spend your time and share magical experience with your loved ones. The staff is so welcoming, charming and pleasant. The breakfast was rich and full of everything. I highly recommend it and me and my family will definitely go back there on our next vacation. A wonderful experience. Lots of love from a couple from Niksic, Montenegro.

title: Value for money!
review: Small hotel but with strategic place , in the center close to everything ( Close to metero , blue mosque , Hagia Sophia Museum , le grand bazar and shopping places )  Rooms very warm with confortable beds , the staff was so nice , friendly , always smiling and so helpful , it was my first time in istanbul and i felt so comfortable at this hotel Just one thing  the Buffet restaurant hasn't lots of choice for 7 days always the same and there's no Bar in the hotel ! just reception and rooms  but Generally it's a nice hotel

title: Super hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: Great hotel! Nice & helpfull staff.
review: This hotel is a real family atmosphere!This hotel has a soulThe most beautiful experience I had a room in this hotelClose to museums, restaurants, public transport...all in a circle.The rooms are great, clean bathroom.Breakfast was good.The staff was very friendly and helpful.Good and fast internet.I do not have any objection.If I go again to Istanbul.We will be staying there again

title: Average Hotel, You pay for the location
review: Thank you for your interest.

title: Great location, improper booking process
review: Recently i had a short stay at Apex ( this was my third time) and i left very happy again. İt seems that the hotel has been taken over by the true owners, so this could only be an improvement, and so it is!! Before the service etc was good too, but now it seems like it got even better, because my room was so much cleaner then it was during my last stay (last year). The new owners told me, they are improving and renewing the hotel (also the interior of the rooms), so i am so curious about what it is going to look like when they are finished 😄! İ will surely book another stay at Apex, within a few months to see for myself😊  İf you are looking for a very central, nice hotel that's not too big, you should try this one! You can go walking to the most "must see" places in İstanbul,…

title: great location,rubbish hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. title: apex is ok but the manager is a cheating liar
review: Room 126, is very small for a deluxe tween room. The hotel is worn and tired. In our three night stay, we needed to ask for towels, the shower room lock to be opened, the extraction fan does not work, no rubbish bin in room. At night I could smell cigarette smoke. Breakfast is limited, at 8.30 they ran out of cheese, butter and milk.

title: Apex means high - this place is LOW!
review: DO NOT STAY HERE  I booked 3 nights, fiorst night it went well in the apex. the manager then moved me into another hotel 10 mins away which was disgusting.  with the single bed in there there was no room for me unless i was lying down, stains all across the walls  i compl,ained and got nowhere  when i got back i took it up with booking.com who at first were helpful, the mamager of the hotel lied on his emails saying "i had requested a move"  If i go to istanbul again I would rather sleep in the street than stay here

title: Great little hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet!
review: This is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in - and I've stayed in the remotest places in the world in a few dire places.  But, this is Istanbul which isn't remote and which I've visited many times over a 40 year period. This dreadful hotel almost destroyed my love of the city. Shall just list the faults in no particular order: Curtains hanging off rails, no volume on TV, bathroom light worked intermittently, room coffee/tea not replenished, windows would only stay open if held by a curtain, antiquated shower with shower head that would not stay in hold, toilet roll holder at ground level behind toilet, bathroom sink with dreadful ugly repair, room furniture should have been trashed years ago, poor lighting, the duvets had no covers, the toilet seat (cheap plastic rubbish)…

title: Monica & Val Apex Hotel great place to stay in Istanbul
review: My husband and I stayed one night here since we opted to do an overnight layover with Turkish Airlines and then get a free tour of the city the next day. The hotel rooms are small and the décor is a bit old but that's the charm of being in the oldest part of town. The room was clean and the bed was not the most comfortable but it was just one night and you are not there to sleep. We wanted to get up early and hear the call of prayer "which sounded amazing". The night we arrived the front desk reception was very helpful we asked if they recommend a restaurant and he did and they came and picked us up and droped us off for no fee because we had dinner at their restaurant. The hotel is in an excellent location literally walking distance from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and the…

title: Nice place in the historic Sultanahmet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Worth the price.
review: Apex hotel: The good things first. Neat and clean, exclusive location, very close to the main attractions Hagia Sophia and the blue mosque. The reception is very cooperative and is always trying to be helpful. Secluded street and quite and peaceful locality. Breakfast not bad, though the arrangement is quiet basic. Don't expect elaborate stuff, but that's ok considering the price.  The bad things. The room could do with a little renovation. Room sizes are quite small with even smaller bathrooms. But that shouldn't matter really, coz the beauty is outside. But yes renovation is a must. The wall finishes are quite old. There was one scary experience though. When we came back in the evening after our day out, we were told that our rooms have been shifted due to some leakage…

title: priceworthy
review: We had a large room, with a functional toilet with hot water. I only paid 30 euro a night on booking.com. Room was quite pretty and beds were comfortable.  Location and view was fantastic.   Breakfast spread was basic. Cheese, olives, coffee and tea and toast. The view from the restaurant was amazing!

title: Bad rooms and breakfast
review: Standard hotel in sultanahmet. Very good location, price is absolutely okay. Friendly staff. Rooms are big and comfortable. Cleanliness could be more better. But otherwise priceworthy. I paid 200 chf = ca.160 euro for 4 nights, double room with couple bed.

title: Comfortable well priced hotel very close to Sultanahmet
review: it was one of the worst hotels i have ever been , i was with my family , the shower has´t got a door so every time you go to shower you will find yourself in a big pool ! blinds fall down just when we arrived  it could hurt my mom but she was lucky . breakfast is very basic and they even has no oil !! , the best thing about it is it near to Sultanahmed

title: APEX, fabulous hotel I have ever seen
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: cozy place in city centre!
review: 3 months ago I stayed in this lovely hotel. It was absolutely prefect to stay in this hotel. Rooms are so comfortable and clean. Breakfast on the terrace aganist to Bosporus is unique and hotel is next to city center. Thanks to helpful and genial receptionists, especially Nijat. Everything was excellent. I don't want write anymore, just one more thing, if you travel Istanbul, certainly you must stay at APEX HOTEL.

title: Not worth the effort
review: one of my friend has request this hotel to me and when i was in istanbul i choose apex hotel with my girlfriend,we stayed there 5 nights and it was like a dream.. staff was excellent,they serve a breakfast on terrace with amazing view and breakfast was so fresh..room was so clean and i like especially location! every where on foot.. if i'll come to istanbul again i'll chose apex hotel exactly!!!

title: Excellent location & decent hotel
review: Location was good, walkable to most sultanahmet locations. But considering a great number of hotels in that area, this hotel is a poor choice. My bedroom was fairly clean, but toilet shower was clogged and remained so even after I informed reception. One of the reception persons didn't understand English, so communication was hard on days when the English speaking receptionist was away. Breakfast was below average, with the cheese spoilt. Also it'd become very noisy in lobby after midnight, and I had to call reception twice during my one week stay, to tell them that I was getting a lot of noise in my room. They told me that the hotel will book shuttle for my trip back to airport and pay it as well, but I later learnt that they never paid the shuttle. Overall, it wasn't worth the…

title: Hotel worth of money spend
review: The best thing about Apex is its excellent location. Within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagya Sohpiya & Top Kapi, it provides easy access to major attractions of Istanbul. Metro access is also nearby for travelling to other parts of the city including airport. My allotted room was of appropriate size with nice ornamental decorations. Breakfast on the rooftop was not grand but decent. Rooftop provides good view of the sea & Blue Mosque. The hotel staff was also nice & welcoming. All in all, this is a good choice considering the price range on offer.

title: We didn't get what we booked
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: LOVED the Location - Good Value
review: At arrival at Apex hotel, we were asked to sign the note - the already drawn amount from the Visa - we didn't get a receipt - but afterwards the receptionist kindly told us, that the bathroom was out of order. He advised another room, at the hotel on the opposite site of the street (same family/company, he said), as we had already paid, we felt we had to accept. We chose this hotel partly because of looks, and the description of rooms with balconyview, but were told, that no rooms had balcony. Unfortunately the bathroom at the other hotel was also out of order. We believe that Apex Hotel might be using this as a trick once in a while.

title: Great location, small rooms, awful breakfast
review: We stayed twice at this hotel, at the beginning of the trip for three nights and again at the end of the trip for two nights.  The rooms are small and the decor run down - but clean and functional.  Being that you are just a VERY short walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, and around the corner from a street of restaurants - we spent so little time in the room that it didn't really deter us in any way.  Camilay is a sweet lady that takes care of breakfast. I loved sitting st breakfast with a view of the water on one side and the Blude Mosque opposite with a cappuccino in hand.  The breakfast food was fresh, classic Turkish breakfast, but simple and minimal.  The shuttle service was an efficient and inexpensive way to get to the airport. It feels like a step up from the…

title: cosy Apex Hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for three days last week. The location is excellent, but the rooms are on the small side, with an odd decoration that I do not think will suit all tastes. Prices are quite reasonable for Istanbul, though. By the way, the shuttle bus to the airport never arrived and we ended up taking a taxi!

title: Best location of possible
review: The hotel has a very good location;you can reach the tourist attractions easily and sightsee the Old City comfortably.Hotel staff is really friendly and they make you feel home.On the terrace, partly overlooking the sea, you can enjoy your breakfast which is prepared very well by the kind lady who I really liked.Hotel is clean but rooms are not too large .If you like you can sit ,chat  and have a rest in the  verandah  designed in the  authentic oriental style . It  is certainly a budget- friendly hotel.I highly reccommend it to everybody who would like to visit İstanbul without spending much money.As a big family  (9)we all enjoyed our stay.

title: Great little hotel, wonderful staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Best & Safe location; Clean but very basis and small rooms
review: Stayed here with my wife in the beginning of May 2013. The hotel is perfectly located with restaurants and sights within minutes' walk, in the wonderful old city of Istanbul. Although small, the room was clean and the service top notch and super friendly. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a weekend in Istanbul.

title: renovation
review: We stayed here for 3 nights in March 2013. The location was fantastic and its a 2 min walk to Blue mosque AND hagia sophia (yes! it takes you 2 mins to reach that park that divides blue mosque and hagia sophia so it takes you right in the middle)  The lane was clean, safe and very sweet and quiet. View from terrace was terrific and you could see the marmara sea.   Our purpose was to have a decent room with clean bed and bathroom. We only used the room to sleep at night and shower in morning before we left. This hotel adequately did that job.  Cons: Shower drain was clogged; breakfast was namesake and very bleh; room very tiny. NOTE: None of this bothered us and if we were to return to IST, we will happily rebook in APEX

title: they renovated hotel
review: it was nice trip with my husband coz this hotel was just located at center of sultanahmet area where is most histrical place in istanbul.  thats why we could turn back to hotel so easily when we bought lots of gifts, then we went back for sightseeing again. even if we forgot something...  and we didnt expect so much about hotel coz price was good, but hotel was just renovated, so the guest room was looking nice and clean. hotel staff were friendly and smiling.  we had good impression about Apex hotel. thank you.

title: Good location
review: i stayed there wit my wife first i afraid to make a reservation about bad comments but price is very good thats why i made reservation and when i arrive hotel stuff was friendly and smiling all the time its makes me feel like family hotel shower is little small but rooms and television and breakfast is great about location it takes just a minute to rich blue mosque and hagia sophia also topkapi palace thanks apex and apex hotel stuff i definilty will recomed all my family and friends.

title: This is a quite nice hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: small room breakfast is poor
review: We satyed there for 5 nights in 2011. actually i booked a standard room at the first floor but they gave us a better room at the 2nd floor with a nice balcony. the breakfast menu includes very basics like cereal , sliced tomatoes, cheese ,hot coffee or tea. but its free and the place where they serve the breakfast is amazing and i also can say everything was so hygienic.the hotel staff is very helpful and friendly even if you have no idea what to do in the city  they always have some activity to offer with a reasonable discount.all in all you will get more than what you have payed.

title: Fantastic Hotel!!!
review: the location of the hotel was very nice. the room was tiny...breakfast was so poor. it was only 1 night to stay there but it is ok.. the price was reasonable .The staff is very friendly, warm, and welcoming..

title: Great hotel in old town
review: We stayed at Apex several times, and really enjoyed our stay. The staff is very friendly, warm, and welcoming, especially Nadim. He us some great tips on getting around the city, and allocated hours in chatting with us about the Turkish history. He even took time to resolve our conflict with a tour company that double charged us. We very much enjoyed our stay in Apex, and would recommend this place in a heart beat. Again, great staff, and great location. Hope you enjoy your time in Istanbul just as much as we did.

title: strongly recommend
review: We were picked up at the airport even though our plane was1hour late.  We were greeted by incredibly friendly staff.  Because we arrived early our room was not ready but once it was cleaned we were offered several rooms to choose from.  Breakfast is not over filling but satisfying.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  Very easy to get around old town from this hotel.  Good restaurants are nearby.  My wife and I highly recommend the Apex to anyone looking for a relatively inexpensive hotel.

title: Nice, quaint hotel in an excellent location that lacks a bit in the breakfast department.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Not clean and very run down!
review: Good budget hotel located central in the Sultanahmet area. Friendly and helpful staff. Overall good room quality. Breakfast could have had better selection though. Was OK.   Close to the tourist attractions. I would give the hotel my recommendations for a mid-budget oriented traveler.

title: Very nice people. Not very nice hotel.
review: Our room was not clean at all and our bathroom needed major renovations.  The owner was friendly but I would not stay there again!

title: Absolutely Disappointed
review: How do I begin? Hotel manager is one of the nicest person I have met in my travels but the hotel is something else. It has taken me more than a month to decide to write this review of my stay at Apex Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey.  I would strongly recommend that the hotel owners give all their bathrooms a complete overhaul. This is to save the business. Do it during the winter period.  I would like to come back to stay with Apex Hotel again. I will come to Tripadvisor and look at pictures to see if improvements have been made.  Thank you.

title: A very pleasant stay in impeccable conditions
review: A total disappointment, i was on a trip to Istanbul. I stayed in Apex Hotel for two days. The Stay was a total disappointment. The Room was shabby, small and poorly furnished, The AC was not working, despite promises made by the staff no one came to rectify the AC. The Shower glass door was broken and all the water spilled into the washroom while i took a bath which made me slip. The Breakfast time was told as 7 to 10 AM but till 8 am no arrangements were made despite various reminders given to the staff. Room wasn't cleaned on both days. There is no Lift in the hotel so one has to climb all the floors by stairs for breakfast or going to the room. Will surely cause huge trouble for elderly people. The standard of teh breakfast was below average. The only plus point the hotel has…

title: Great place
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice Hotel, very friendly receptionists
review: Great place to stay while on visit to Istanbul. Perfect service, professiona and kind and incredibely informative. Perfect location, walking distance from most available sites. In the heart of it all! I was exspecially happy about the fact that requested outside takeaway ordering was available for just inside my hotel room when needed. And the minibar was excellent in its mulitple choices at offer as well as the walk out balcony was a plus for any attraction worth viewing from my street overlooking room.

title: wow amzing i m very enjoy in istanbul
review: we stayed one week, nice experience,   the receptionists helped us a lot especially Ceyhan, Luqman and Nedim.  Very good Breakfest  the hotel is located only two minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in the Sultanahmet district

title: Old and dirty
review: hotel apex i very enjoy apex hotel staff is very good service  Excellent. İn morning roof was so nice with sea veiw and blue mouqse evry think was great and aur room was so perty ,, if i come again in istanbul i will stay in apex hotel............,

title: Great Location, excellent staff
review: I stayed there for one night, since the hotel I had booked had a problem and it wasn't a great night. The place is quiet but the place is so old that you feel as a (poor) sultan. The breakfast was also very poor, which I had to share with many birds.

title: professional staff, clean hotel in excellent location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: True valued for money hotel
review: Excellent service from reception staff, who telephoned me when our coach was running 3 hours late, aid not to worry that the rooms were ready and waiting. Arrived at 3.30am, exhausted to be greeted by lovely staff member who checked us in quickly provided us with basic information i.e. map and breakfast times and showed us to our clean rooms. Wonderful location, nice roof terrace for breakfast with good choice of cheese / olives / cereals (what more do you need?) and plentyful hot coffee.

title: Find somewhere else
review: Just ignore all bad comments, if you come to travel around Istanbul and not expect to stay in hotel much....this hotel is a must choice!!!! Room is fine, some problem with AC but still a good sleep. Breakfast also fine....but the most impressive thing is Staff which really generous and helpful....  Stay this hotel if you are real traveller!!!!!!!

title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location, Quiet Street, and Awesome Service
review: Before booking this hotel through expedia, I read some of the reviews here on trip advisor.  I ignored the people who had had bad experiences with this hotel, assuming it wouldn't happen to me. Unfortunately, it did: I paid for a room at the Apex but was placed further down the hill at their affiliate, Sultan's Eyes.  My single room was very small, had bad hot water, and had the constant company of ants (first discovered crawling out of my computer (!), which I had left in my locked suitcase on the floor (no opened food in it)), then making their way up my legs as I sat on the bed.  Don't believe the hype--find another place, there are plenty nearby.

title: not a place go back to
review: Although there have been previous reviews of this hotel not being up to par, we had an excellent stay here and would stay here again. You cannot beat the location, it is less thank a KM away from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia. And only a short walk from the nearest tram station called Sultanahmet. We got upgraded to a nice room on the third floor which was awesome as well. If you are looking for a spacious room then here is not where you want to go. But if you are like any adventurous traveler you will not spend much time in the room anyways. The shower and toilet were okay although we did have some problems nothing to major. You will hear the 430 AM prayer calls if you keep the window open so I would just close it.  The staff was great and helped us whenever needed. The FREE…

title: great choice
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Beware!!  Bait and Switch
review: The hotel is located at a quite street very close to agia sofia and the blue mosque. The employees at the reception were exceptionally polite and they could speak english rather fluently. The manager of the hotel was also very helpful when we asked him  to make a reservation change. The room was cosy and was being cleaned every morning. The breakfast is served on a balcony on the top floor with great view. I would suggest this hotel with no second thought!

title: Stingy management
review: So you know how you sometimes you read that lone trip advisor review that's horrible and you're like "that sucks, but what are the chances that will happen to me?"  Well, apparently they are pretty good!!  Another reviewer wrote about a bait and switch about 1 month ago, and I read it, and still booked because of all the other positive reviews.  However, when I arrived to check in, the couple ahead of me was having trouble.  They had booked at APEX, but there was no room for them, so they would have to stay 100 meters away at the "sister" hotel.  Off they went.  So now I go to check in, same situation!!  how many rooms are they going to overbook? and I was staying more than one night!  So i'm laid back, I go with the flow, go to check out this other hotel.   It's called the…

title: Excellent location, service and value
review: Good: Location is good being very near many of the most desirable attractions and the price is lower than some surrounding hotels.  Bad: stingy beyond belief. It became a joke between my wife and me saying: "sure we have "x" ....- but you can't use it!".  There are fan/AC units but they removed the remotes because "it is not hot enough for ac yet".  There are shower jet panels but the valve handles have been removed.  There is a glass cabinet proudly displaying the yogurt, milk, etc that you would like to enjoy for breakfast at the rooftop but  it is locked.  The server hardly ever gets around to setting these things out and if you ask you can be sure to never have them.  Maintenance was lacking also. The shower hose and nozzle were broken so that you could not secure it…

title: What a Sweet Hotel
review: We stayed at the Apex hotel for 5 nights.  We were very happy with our choice.  The location of the hotel is perfect.  The service was amazing.  Ceyan, who works at the reception desk, was extremely helpful and kind.  He is possibly the nicest and most helpful person we have ever met.

title: Bait and switch? No, more like Sell and then switch
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Best Location, Friendly Staff, Great Price
review: I feel aggrieved at what this hotel just did to us.  We went to Istanbul for the Easter weekend and when we arrived with our printed out direct confirmation from the hotel itself were told that there was no room for us. What are people meant to do in such circumstances, wonder off and try and find another place on a rack-rate at 5pm?  We were told that we would be put up at an associated hotel 100 metres away, and upgraded from a standard double to a suite. But the place we ended up is ranked something like 150th in Istanbul, versus 50th for the Apex. Plus we had the rigmarole of re-checking in with reception who could not seem to grasp that we were referred at our booked rate and not simply walk-in customers on the rack-rate. Then the 'suite' well it was their best room, but it…

title: Lovely staff, perfect location
review: I stayed at the apex 4 nights at my 4th visit to the most beautiful city in the world. We were 2 women traveling, we never felt unsafe at the hotel, Lockman, Yacob and Yassin took care of us and helped us. Our room was perfect, the location was great and the price was very affordable. I will go back to the apex next year during my 5th visit to Istanbul. I loved the hotel and the staff.

title: Perfectly located hotel for a long stay in Istanbul
review: I spent 2 nights in this hotel and I was extremely happy and satisfied with everything. Service is excellent, everybody is willing to do the extra mile to make your stay comfortable. They are really like a family and the hotel is like staying at home - with a lovely balcony used for breakfast. Breakfast is really good, good variety and the view is second to none. Perfect beginning of your day! My room was spacious, clean, comfortable, quite with all the necessary amenities. Great tea selection!  Location is perfect, few minutes walking distance from the most popular hisotrical buildings in Sultanhamet, from the seaside, etc. I will be back to Istanbul and I would not stay anywhere else. Thank you, all of you, who looked after me during my stay.

title: Great recommendation from Trip Advisor
review: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night more by chance. Wondering whether to stay in a hotel at all with a flight at 5 a.m I decided to go for the cheapest hotel I could find in Istanbul. It was a fantastic choice. Located 5 minutes walk from the Topkapi, Blue Mosque, in a quiet street in Sultanhamet, a quiet area away from all the hustle and bustle of Istabul. A taxi to the airport took 20 mimutes and cost 40 lira. I wish I had stayed here for all 4 days of my long weekend. The whole hotel is spotless, the rooms have all amenities you could wish for.

title: nice hotel in old city
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great hotel in fantastic location
review: We found the hotel by a online agent. it is in the old city of Istanbul with nice rooms. The staff is also friendly and welcoming. Especially very handy to tram station. good value for vacation.

title: I LOVE APEX HOTEL !
review: I have been remiss for not writing this review sooner.  My mother 75yrs and myself stayed at this hotel for two nights before we headed to the shipping docks to board a cruise liner.  Our experience of this hotel was 1.  very close to the tram statıon.  2.  very close to tourist attractions like the Blue Mosque and Cistern.  3.  Our room was nıce and clean.  Although we were there in the winter we still had our breakfast outside on the upstairs deck, by the way breakfast was delıcıous.  4.  The staff were great from my online booking with numerous emails through to carrying our bags to and from our rooms.  I also received a Blue Mosque statue which has pride of place among my many travel treasures.  5.  I would not hesitate in returning.

title: very nıce hotel!!
review: Apex hotel is really lovely the staff is friendly , the rooms are comfortable , clean and really beautiful !! it's because of this hotel that i enjoyed my holiday at Istanbul for the very first time!!  wish all the best to all the staff over there !! i will always go there every time i go to Istanbul , Love you apex hotel !! <3

title: I don't recommend!! We didn't get a room!!
review: were came to thıs hotel. very close tram statıon& blue mosque  nıce vıew, and room ıs very clean and every day breakfast ıs delıcıous.  and every day clean room survıce ıs best! staff ıs very kınd and frıendly were a lot of request to staff, they are always kındly reply    tatal - very nıce hotel .we wıll comback!!

title: nice little hotel in a good location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Above and beyond
review: Stayed here for one night in December 2010. This is a nice little hotel, within 10 min walk of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. A bit hard to find at first, but once you find it the location is great. Had a lovely stay for my last night in Istanbul!  Amazing little rooms with heat and a good clean bathroom. Terrific to have internet in the room!   Just a few little FYIs for future travelers looking up this hotel on Tripadvisor that are no means criticism of the hotel and absolutely have not been considered in my review :   The rooftop terrace, where breakfast is served, can be a bit chilly in the winter as the plastic sheeting that serves to help keep out the elements does not keep out the cold. You may want to bring your coat the first day you are there if traveling in the winter…

title: Lots of room in this hotel, but only for improvement.
review: We booked online so didn't know what the rooms would be like in reality. They're not great but they're clean and comfortable. The big plus here is that the staff are very helpful in fact they are more helpful than most staff at 5 star hotels.

title: perfect place for sight seeing.
review: In my book a good budget hotel must have unquestionable cleanliness, a comfortable bed and a decent bathroom/shower. Rating the Apex hotel against these I would give it a 'fair' rating.  My first impression of the hotel was soured by the smell of bad plumbing that pervades the lobby and staircase. Luckily our room was odor free and looked generally clean. The decor was nice, if a bit kitschy. Our triple room had three single beds set in a row and felt a bit cramped at times. The bathroom was small but not tiny and had a modern looking shower. Unfortunately the fancy shower didn't work properly and the water trickled out of the shower head rather than exploded. The hotel has a free wireless internet connection, however the connection on our floor was not working. We reported it…

title: Excellent value for money
review: didn't had big expectations about this hotel to begin with. but they turned around my views and was very happy that i have chosen this hotel. first of all, it was located near to blue mosque which is one central part of istanbul and so close to many sight seeing places. hotel is small, but their service is very good. rooms are well decorated and comfortable. prices are very very reasonable and you have added benefit of free wifi acess.  but the big plus point for the hotel is their staff. very pleasing, helpful, always pleasant and they will make you feel so comfortable.   to end with, some not so plus points...the bathroom was small ( probably not all ). they have lot of breakfast choices, may not be to your liking. but i liked their choices. it's not like 5 star variety, but…

title: Cozy hotel in the heart of Old City
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Thank you for the lovely place
review: My husband and me spent 3 nights at the Apex Hotel and it has been a great deal! The hotel is nice, room clean and breakfast tasty. You get everything you need.    Location is fantastic just few meters away from Blue Moschee, Saint Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The staff was really friendly and ready to satify our requests or to advice us where to go.

title: Great location and super-friendly staff
review: Very nice cozy place - small and friendly. The whole area though is full of nice little hotels like this one. It's a great destination in Istanbul.

title: comfortable hotle
review: Apex is a good mid-budget hotel that is very conveniently located for all the sights of Old Istanbul. What makes it special are the people who work there. They make a great effort to be helpful and personable. For example, on my father's birthday, they surprised all of us with a cake.

title: Home away from home!!
review: Apex is a perfect place to stay. The staff was very nice and friendly and helpful. hotel location is excellent, Breakfast was good on the roof top terrace very nice view. The staff speak English . Free internet.  Room and bathroom was clean. Thank's for Mr.Ibrahim , Mr.Lukman , Mr.Elias and Miss.Ozlam. Thank's for every body in Apex hotel.

title: Nice boutique hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location and reasonable value
review: I stayed here for one night at the very end of my trip, in the hopes of saving some money.  The rest of my time in Istanbul, I stayed at Millennium Suites, which was wonderful, but cost more.  Overall, excellent for the money.  You'd never consider this a five-star hotel, but that's not what you should expect given the very low price.  I think of this as a very cozy, serviceable boutique.  The front staff is extremely friendly (almost a bit too friendly when you're exhausted, but can hardly blame them for that).  The rooms are not huge, but comfortable enough.    The beds are a bit on the hard side.  And the bathroom is tiny tiny.  Still, I enjoyed my one night here, and would stay again on this budget.

title: harika.....!perfect......hotel at the best place!tessekur enderim from greeks!
review: This place has a great location, with a central location but also quiet enough since it is further back from the main street. The staff are reasonably helpful, although at times I wondered whether they completely understood my questions. They, thankfully, helped us print our plane tickets the night before. We had difficulties with a missing plugin on the main computer, but in the end it was figured out.   The rooms were small and my gripe is mainly with the washrooms. We couldn't figure out how to use the shower. The breakfast was buffet-style but fairly minimal. We had a hard time getting an early breakfast. The staff were usually still putting things together after we had finished and left. I don't think we were able to have anything that was served hot.

title: Terrible - worst hotel experience ever
review: It was really very friendly the people and the place at the hotel......I m from Greece and really...I couldn t beleive that in turkish I would have the best vacations ever! The hotel has the anatolian character and the rooms as well...with very beautiful and hot design! Turkish people at the hotel very friendly!.....I m looking forward to go again there! Tessekur enderim kardasia

title: Quiet, lovely staff, great location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A customer friendly small hotel in a location convenient to the main sights.
review: The hotel is in a great location near all major sites in Sultanahmet. We were able to walk to all sites from the hotel. The staff is wonderful-- they made us feel welcome and made us laugh as well. The rooftop terrace is lovely with great views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. There is also a quiet, shaded sitting area in front of the hotel, which is a nice place to rest, talk and have a cup of tea (which the staff always seemed happy to provide). The rooms were a bit small, but comfortable, quiet and clean.

title: Warm hospitability
review: We were greeted like family on our arrival  and throughout our stay treated almost as family by the hotel team. They went out of their way to help make our stay memorable. They were able to recommend good restaurents local to the hotel, provide travel tips and suggestions  for sightseing. Rooms clean and comfortable, with working aircon. Ideal position for the main sights.

title: Excellent staff good location rooms require some attention
review: The hotel is clean, nice and near to the most important touristic attractions located in the old city of Istanbul. The staff is very friendly and ready anytime to meet the guests requirements.

title: location, location, location
review: In common with other reviews the staff at the Apex are the hotels greatest asset, helpful courteous and friendly. The location is excellent for visiting all the main touris sights in Sultanahmet. Our only reservation was that our room was 'tired' and would have benefitted from a degree of decorative refurbishment and  maintenance of the fittings.

title: Fantastic service makes all the difference.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent location with outstanding service
review: My wife and I have stayed in all sorts of places, backpackers thru to 5 star hotels.  And, whilst the Apex is certainly not a 5-star hotel, our stay there was one of the best we've had anywhere.  The staff there are the best - friendly, attentive, courteous, helpful.  They made our stay in Istanbul very pleasant.  We also got a great rate, at which we believe it to be a bargain.    Negatives:the breakfast wasn't the best we've had in Istanbul, and it is a little difficult to find at first, but hey, thats Sultanhamet.  We'd recommend the place to anyone.

title: Brilliant hotel!
review: I just stayed at the Apex Hotel for the second time in a year and thoroughly enjoyed my time there. It is just a short walk to the seaside, fish restaurants, and pubs and restaurants below the Blue Mosque. The hotel is located on a quiet street. The service is impeccable. Emrah is forever helpful at the front desk and Ibrahim makes sure everything is in top order for you. These guys are more like great friends or family! They make me feel at home in Istanbul, and I will certainly stay there again. See you guys at the White House! David

title: Great location and wonderful staff
review: I don't have enough nice things to say about this hotel. It was clean, excellent location, quiet (we were on the top floor) and the staff were unbelievably friendly and helpful. It's about 5 minutes walk from the Haga Sophia and Blue Mosque, and not far from other sights.   Rooms are fairly spacious, clean and the decor is great. We had a few cupboard door handles come loose, but even that just seems to add to the charm! The staff are fantastic, will offer any amount of help and welcome you to sit and order pizza with them! Really nice place, great atmosphere.

title: Warm welcome, excellent service, remodeled rooms!
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Apex Hotel.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room we stayed in was clean and spacious.  Emrah had excellent recommendations on restaurants and directions how to get to them.  The location is perfect for all the main sights.  There really is no other place to stay when in Istanbul then the Apex!

title: Extremely nice staff and very good location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Turkish hospitality in its best
review: Our stay was part of a quite long trip. We had a not pleasant surprise at first as the double room was not available. After a friendly discussion we got the room.  The staff, mainly young people, Emrah and the other guys, were extremely nice and helpful all the time. All the stay was very good. The hotel, a tipical boutique is ok, but could be better. The location, in old Sulthahmet is very good, close to a lot of historical places and not far from the tramway, which is very useful.

title: Enjoyable hotel
review: A lot is written about hospitality of people working in this hotel. What can I add? I can only assure you that it's really true!  I has just asked about possibility of changing room to the one with the city view and in five minutes I was moving my luggage without any additional charge.  And finally before my leaving I got a wonderfull turkish coffe from guest relations girl who really cares about all guests.  The only thing which can bother is that everything what is screwed in the wall do not work :) I mean they need to take new screws and make it again.

title: Unexpected delight
review: Apex is a perfect place to stay - nice and warm atmosphere, friendly staff, comfortable (not large) rooms, good terrace view, calm street, near most of Istanbul attractions.

title: Great location, nonexistent breakfast
review: I stayed here 'by accident' due to the volcanic ash cloud but really fell on my feet. It is the perfect place to explore the historic part of the city. You can have breakfast with a view of the blue mosque. It is in a quiet road, but also a short walk to some busy, party, streets with the youth hostels etc, so you can choose to enjoy that side of the nightlife, or to go elsewhere as you see fit. The staff in this hotel were great fun and very helpful. They even offered me some delicious home cooked food that they were having for their lunch! I would be happy to stay at Apex again with its interesting (if compact) rooms if/when I return to Istanbul.

title: romantic heaven to stay with
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: An excellent little hotel with very friendly staff in a great location
review: A stylish cozy boutique hotel with great room accommodations, polite and helpful staff and excellent pricing. Centrally located to all essential sightseeing of Istanbul right in heart of historical part of Istanbul - Sultanahmet, this is a MUST stay for those in on personal travel and even romantic vacations. By the way, it is located in a quiet area surrounded with fairy tail and other beautiful small hotels within 5 minutes from Aia Sofia, Blue Mosk and may be 10 minutes from Grand Bazaar. I have stayed at this Apex hotel on several occasions now and rate it very reasonable. Why? Because the service is excellent, the staff are consistently pleasant and helpful, go out of their way to assist and the room I continue to choose has excellent light and views (such as they are).…

title: Great hotel! Great people!
review: An excellent little hotel with very friendly staff in a great location in central istanbul.

title: Comfortable clean, well located and good value
review: This is a nice little hotel in the heart of the main historical district in Istanbul. Our room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast (Coffee, tea, bread, cheese, meats, etc) on the rooftop was fantastic way to start the day. The hotel staff are fantastic, going out of their way on many many occasions to help, give advice and make our stay more enjoyable.   If we go back to Istanbul we would definitely stay here again!

title: Good hotel for its price. Excellent staff who go out of their way to help tourists
review: I agree with the other reviews that the great thing about this hotel is the pleasant and apparently genuine nature of the people running it. The room was about three star  but the staff, the convenient location, a comfortable bed, and nice views from the rooftop breakfast area meant that it was a five star place to stay.

title: You will not find a better hotel...truly amazing
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Best value in Istanbul!
review: If you want peace of mind...choose Apex hotel If you want to feel at home.. choose Apex hotel If you want a beautiful buffet breakfast overlooking the Bosphorus and Blue Mosque... choose Apex hotel If you want staff to meet all your need... choose Apex hotel If you want spotless clean rooms... choose Apex hotel If you want to be picked up from the airport... choose Apex hotel If you want advice on what to do during your time in Istanbul... choose Apex hotel If you want value for money... choose Apex hotel If you want free internet... choose Apex hotel If you want a hotel that is 2mins walk from Arasta Bazaar, 4mins from Blue Mosque, 6mins from Hagia Sofia, 7mins from Sultanahmet tram station, the Hippodrome, the tomb of Sultanahmet, the Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum, Topkapi…

title: Excellent french fries for breakfast
review: The staff of the Apex Hotel were wonderful, the free buffet breakast was generous and the location of the hotel is incredible!  Easily the best value in Istanbul!

title: Friendliness of staff and close location to all major sites
review: Staff extraordinarily friendly and welcoming.  The breakfast was very good and tasty, clean rooms, nearness of the historical sights, free transfer from Attaturk Airport.

title: Great Value, Great Hotel
review: Even though the room was a litle small, the friendliness of  the staff and closeness to all the major sites was worth it, as we only used our room for sleeping.  The breakfast buffet on the hotel Terrace had a breath-taking view of Miramar Sea.  The breakfast was very goo too, lots to choose from.  The manager was so gracious and met our every need from getting my new laptop started up to making phonecalls.  If every hotel treated their customers this way they would  all be repeat customers.  Coffee was provided in the lobby 24-7, which was nice.  This hotel had the ambiance and romance of  a bed and breakfast only quieter.  Hotel is on a back street, away from th noise of any trafic so that was nice too.   The morning call to worship didnot  disrupt my sleep either,   Like…

title: Nice, caring and helpful.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent Experience
review: I stayed at Apex hotel for four nights and I must admit all the staff were very friendly and helpful. They do not speak English as good as I would expect in England but you can communicate quite easily. They arranged hotel for me in Cappadocia and gave them personal assurance that I will not cancel the booking. They helped me find an economical flight to Konya and helped me book on Turkish Airline's Turkish website, as the same flight was TL100 dearer on the English website. I stayed at three more hotels in Turkey but their breakfast was better than all others.  My parents are planning to visit Istanbul this April and I have already suggested them to stay at Apex.

title: This Hotel Lives to its Name
review: I booked this hotel, reviewing the comments on the hotel on Trip Advisor. I found the experience of staying in the hotel excellent. The front desk is extremely helpful and gave us good advice on the tours and transport arrangements. The rooms were decent and we found our stay very enjoyable. A great bargain for the price we paid.   Zahid

title: Loved It
review: Apex is an Awesome experience for us (me & my wife). We got more than we expected after reading reviews about hotel from the hotel and its staff. I would specially like to mention about the kind of guidance Emrah(receptionist)has provided us in exploring Istanbul and its lesser known places. He has answers to all our queries during our stay in Hotel, and more importantly the answers were perfect. Thank you Emrah & entire Apex Hotel staff for all your support during our memorable stay in Istanbul.

title: Excelent hotel and wonderfull staf, the best option in Istambul
review: I only stayed at the Apex for one night.  In the middle of the night I had an allergic reaction to medication.  The staff went out of their way to care for me.  They called a doctor to my hotel room and bought food to the room as well.  They would not let me leave my room until they took me to airport the next day.  I have never been treated so well by hotel staff in my life.  The hotel is in a great location and although I only had one day to explore the city before becoming ill, everything was in reach so I actually did manage to explore some of the important sights of this great city.  An email from staff before my arrival actually said at the hotel it is warm and friendly and like family.  This turned out to be so true.  I will always look to this hotel as my first choice on…

title: Very good hotel, exceeds expectation,
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great place to stay!
review: Location amazing 2 minute walking from Aya Sophia and sultan ahmet money value amazing, staff friendliness beyond expectations, room have an amazing design, i recommend it to any budget traveller family, the  Manager Ibrahim and the working staff Emrah and Osman were very friendly people and i would go there again,

title: Friendly, Hospitable, Clean, Excellent Location & Well Priced!
review: We stayed here for 5 nights, the room was lovely, not very big but you're out and about during the day. The staff were excellent, very very helpful and friendly, the location is fantastic-right in the heart of Sultanahmet, lot's of restauraunts and bars just around the corner, yet at night it was very peaceful. It's very near the Blue Mosque-no better location! The attention to detail in the rooms was great, slippers, fluffy dressing gowns, toiletries, kettle, tea, coffee etc- TV too! There's also a safe- not that we felt like we needed one but it's there anyway, minibar too- everything you could wish for and 24hour reception staff who actually want to help you. GREAT TIP- to get back to the airport- taxi costs 30 Euros- get on the tram near the Blue Mosque to Zeytinburnu, then…

title: a warm and intimate stay in an ideal location in the heart of historic old town istanbul
review: Great little place!  Stayed with my girlfriend and another couple.  We had orange juice and coffees on arrival, all the help possible during our stay and sandwiches  on departure!  Staff are lovely, rooms are traditional and very clean.  Would definitely go back and would Definitely recommend!

title: Friendliest staff
review: We had a wonderful time at the Apex Hotel.  It exceeded our expectations in its charm and hospitality.  Ibrahim, the manager, consistently went out of his way to offer information, services, and friendliness.    We felt exceedlingly well cared for by the entire staff.  One evening the cook prepared special homemade food and we were invited to share dinner with the staff celebrating Ramadan.  We received helpful information that enabled us to make the most of our visit to Istanbul.  For the money we couldn't think of a better place to stay in Istanbul.  Give Ibrahim a call.

title: Ideal location with perfect ambiance
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great place at great price
review: Located just steps from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the historic cistern and Topkapi Palace.   The rooftop terrace breakfast buffet affords a breathtaking view of the Sultanahmet district, the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus.  The Apex is a jewel with a friendly knowledgeable staff.    ,

title: Quiet well run hotel convenient for all the sites
review: After reading the other review online, I decided to book this hotel.  My email inquiries were always answered in a timely fashion, and were always polite.  Upon arrival, we were greeted by Lokman Yunushan, the person whom I had been emailing with.  He could not have been any more hospitable or polite.
