We were treated like family, and offered our choice of a double room or a triple.  Although there were just the two of us, we chose the triple room.  It is about the size of a standard US room, but there are three twin beds.  The double was very small with only one double bed, so we opted for the extra space.  The room was clean and comfortable, with a modern shower and clean bathroom.  In the morning, you can go up to the terrace to experience what a breakfast in Istanbul…

title: A home-away-from-home in the heart of historic Istanbul
review: Whilst possibly not the most glamorous hotel you could book it was well managed and very very hospitable. The manager and staff were ever helpful without being pushy, in fact when a better room became available at short notice we were offered it at no extra cost. The rooms were comfortable and breakfast was enjoyable one the roof terrace. And it was conveniently located near the blue mosque so site seeing was easy.

title: Great location, friendly owner/staff, great value.
review: We recently stayed at the Apex Historic Hotel for five nights, and appreciated finding it on tripadvisor.com.  The location is perfect for exploring Istanbul, and the neighborhood was charming, friendly, and felt very safe. The staff was very helpful, breakfast was lovely, and the room was quite comfortable. We felt like we were "at home" while there.

title: Don't Stay Here
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Good hotel, but not great hotel....
review: We can't understand the good reviews this hotel has received in the past on TripAdvisor - which was the only reason we chose it!  This hotel is overpriced, not particularly clean and across the road from two excellent hotels either of which would be a much better choice.  The friendliness of the staff does not compensate for the tired rooms, average breakfast and scruffy decor.  If you are looking for an hotel in this area of Sultanamet try the Ferman or the Aveccina across the street which are a similar price and of a much higher standard.

title: Front desk staff the most helpful ever found
review: First time to Istanbul, wonderful city!! Hotel was good, but cannot see why it is so popular with Tripadvisor reviewers? It is a good three star hotel, no more. The room was probably the smallest I have ever stopped in!  Breakfast was on roof top, it rained the last two days and was quite cold. I realise that for most of the year Istanbul is sunny, but there were no area to eat indoors? Staff were very helpful and friendly, and excellent location. I appreciate the price we paid, 50 Euro's per night, for the area we were stopping was very good value, and some great restaurants also, but sorry, cannot see what all the fuss is about.

title: Average at best. Great location but hotel left a lot to be desired
review: Stayed at this hotel with another couple. We are all well travelled & rated the hotel highly. Ideal for a short break visit., and within easy walking distance of Blue Mosque & good restaurants. The rooms were modest, but clean and the beds the most comfortable we have found in some time. The staff were so friendly & helpful...the owner vetted my list of suggested restaurants, and the desk readily telephoned attractions to check on opening times etc. & to book restaurants.

title: Cozy
review: Booked this hotel based on price and strength of the reviews. I can't fault the helpfulness of staff but this really is not a great hotel. Rooms are very small, we were moved out of the first room which was so small it had a mini wardrobe propped up near the door.   Location is fantastic but the hotel is very basic. Not boutique in any sense of the word. Next time I will pay more and have a little bit more comfort.

title: If you go once, you will go again!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent service!
review: Very nice boutiqe hotel, in the historical centre of Istanbul, in a quite and beautiful little street, only 5 minutes walk from Saint Sofia and the tram stop.  The personel is very friendly, kind, willing, helpful, polite. The rooms are very clean with nice decoration. A little bit small but no problem. The breakfast is full of goods, what I expected to find. Nothing more and nothing less than a good hotel breakfast! Thank you Apex, I enjoyed my visit to your hotel and I hope to visit Istanbul again soon!

title: Like going for a visit to friends
review: Excellent location and friendly, helpful people managing the hotel. Lots of good restaurants near by.

title: Happy Hotel
review: A very nice and cozy boutique hotel. As expected, the rooms were relatively limited in space (especially the single ones). However, the friendliness and politeness of the owner and staff were outweighing the space limitations. Very close to the main attractions of the medieval town. Clean and quiet.  Maybe the price could be a little cheaper. Still, I totally suggest it, especially if one doesn't require amenities of a luxury hotel and can cope with something more modest. I am definitely coming back again soon!

title: A fantastic hotel, in a perfect location with excellent staff.
review: Very friendly, very convenient , happy hotel. And a bargain. Only problem ? I could not for the life of me work the shower properly. But that could just be me.........

title: A wonderful small hotel and staff.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: One of my best hotel experiences in my travels
review: We have never stayed at such a friendly hotel.  We spent four days in Instanbul and Ibrahim and his staff were delightful.  They could not do enough for us.  We came in late one night and his family was having a wonderful meal on the terrace and they insisted  we join them.  The food was all home cooked and was great.  The location was great and the air-conditioning worked great.   Jack and LInda,  Granbury, Texas

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: I saw this place on Trip Advisor when I was planning my trip to Istanbul and thought I'd give it a shot.  I was very impressed with this small, intimate hotel.  While I was there, I had a touch of bronchitis and the hotel manager walked with me to the pharmacy and bought me some cough medicine.  I've never had anyone go that far out of thier way to make me happy at a hotel before.  Not only is the service incredible, the location is perfect for travelers looking to see all the sights of Istanbul.  I can't say enough nice things about this place.  If I ever go back to Istanbul, this is the place I'm going to stay.

title: Incredible hotel
review: Ibrahim and his colleagues at this wonderful hotel could not have done more to make us feel welcome and comfortable.  I would go back here again in a shot if I could!  Thank you all.

title: A wonderful hotel- the staff were amazing!
review: First of all the hotel is in a very good spot.It is five minutes away from many sightseeings like Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque.The staff also was very polite and very helpful.

title: The Hotel with a heart and soul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A home away from home
review: This hotel was like being at home, Ibrahim and his staff treat you like family. When I originally arrived at the hotel I was very distraught, first by the nightmare of a flight from Casablanca to Istanbul, and that topped off with lost luggage. By time I got to the hotel I was in tears, it was 7 in the morning and I hadn't slept for over 24 hours. The first thing I was told to do was get some sleep and we would take care of everything after I rested. When I did wake up I felt a lot better. Ibrahim contacted AMEX for me to discuss my luggage protection plan. He then offered me food, but what was really amazing was that he sent one of his staff to take me shopping for some replacement clothes etc. I was taken from store to store, my bags were carried for me and also my receipts.…

title: Genuinely friendly  - couldn't do enough to help
review: Superb!!! I stayed alongwith my family for three days at the hotel. And I was amazed by the hospitality of the staff who seemed to be no less than a family. Situated close to most of the tourist attractions, it was a perfect place to be. One of the most memorable stays i had away from home. The hotel facilities were immaculate and the services highly appreciable.It all made us fall in love with Istanbul and its people. Wish all the best. Dr Hamid.

title: Four Seasons service and experience at 1/4 of the price!! Absolutely Wonderful Hotel!
review: We travel a lot and choose to stay in the smaller "character" hotels in the centre of town. From previous experience choosing the right boutique hotel can be quite hit and miss -but the Apex was a delight. The facilities and location were really good and the cost the best we experienced this summer in Europe - perhaps more importantly the service was fantastic.  Just ask.

title: Nice hotel with super views and even better service!
review: I stayed at this hotel after reading the good reviews on TripAdvisor and must say that Mr. Imbrahim Billik and his Staff definately over delivered! This hotel is located in the old town Sultanahmet and is 5minutes walking from Blue Mosque and Sofia Mosque, and there is so much to do just walking around and experiencing the history of the old town.  When you stay at a 5 star hotel, you pay for plush accomodation and location, but most importantly, its the personailzed service and attention that usually differentiates such hotels from the rest. Apex Hotel far exceeds the level of service, attention, and care than I have recieved at 90% of 5 star hotels i have stayed at, I cannot reiterate how accomodating and willing the staff are to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as…

title: Great service, charm and views
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Perfect location and a comfortable stay
review: We loved the hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive. We loved having the delicious breakfast on the rooftop terrace with views of the Blue Mosque and the Marmaran Sea. Location was perfect for seeing the main sights and the street was very quaint. Our kids felt most welcome, too. Rooms were on the small side but very clean with comfortable beds. We would definitely stay here again!

title: My favourite hotel ever
review: A perfect location within minutes walking distance of the Blue Mosque and the historical centre of Istanbul.  The hotel is in a very quiet cobblestoned road  that fortunately misses out on traffic and crowds.  The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming.  They kept a low profile; always on hand to help if needed but without imposing themselves.  The rooms were clean and comfortable with amazing character.  We felt at ease throughout our stay; it provided a base for a very relaxed, comfortable and enjoyable stay.

title: Location, Location, Location and above all super friendly staff.
review: M wife and I stayed at the Apex hotel this month for 7 nights. It is an absolutely fantastic hotel, with everything you could possibly need. Great location on a lovely little street, clean rooms (which are full of character) and a roof terrace for eating breakfast on.  The staff are friendly and helpful and so welcoming. I really couldn't reccommend this hotel any more highly.  Brilliant.

title: Very good service!!!
review: We stayed for 2 nights at the Apex Hotel, we have just returned from our European holiday and I can honestly say the hotel Manager and staff are a credit to the hotel and we did not receive the same level of service on any of our hotel destinations in Europe. The room was very clean and a very good size ( we were 3 travellers ). The noise level was very minimal and the bathroom was a good size as well. The hotel is in close proximity to all the major tourist attractions and we were able to walk almost anywhere and still be only about 15 minutes from the hotel.The ocean could be seen from the hotel's balcony where breakfast was served. ( breakfast could be improved upon ) I would recommend this hotel highly for its cleanliness, friendliness and courtesy of the staff however my…

title: Wonderful place in the old city Istanbul
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Amazing hotel, exceptional location and the best service I have ever experienced
review: There was a four days where we spent our times in a plesant way. Our guests made us to feel in their hotel like in our home. Many thanks to Mr. Ibrahim and his nephew.

title: Great hotel, amazing service and location.
review: I have travelled quite extensively and I can honestly say that the Apex Hotel is the best hotel I have every stayed at. What differentiates this hotel from all others is the customer service which quite simply is at a level which I have never experienced and doubt I will ever again. As this is a small boutique hotel, run personally by the owner and his fantastic staff they truly treat you as though you are part of the family. I was welcomed with drinks and fruit and given a detailed description of what to do and where to go in Istanbul, and on the day i left they provided me lunch as i waited to go the airport. The staff were always there to help with any question I had.  The rooms are great, the airconditioning fantastic which is vital considering the heat of Istanbul in…

title: Wonderful stay in the heart of the city
review: I stayed at the Apex hotel with my wife and two friends for two nights.  There is no better location for a hotel in Istanbul.  The service and the cleanliness in the hotel was above anything I have ever since and I have stayed in many hotels before.  The concierge and the manager were very friendly, we felt very comfortable talking to them and asking them questions.  Breakfast was average but good, and our room specifically was a little bit small.  We strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Good hotel!
review: We loved our stay in the hotel.  In particular Ibrahim and his staff made sure that all of our travel needs were understood and addressed.  He provided an impromptu lunch when we didn't hav time to go out, suggested places to visit, and was simply helpful.  A great place.  For example, he helped us find a great Turkish Bath.

title: Honest and hospitable staff, amazing service, and beautiful location!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great Little Hotel
review: I cannot say enough about the integrity and friendliness of the owner and staff of Apex.  They assisted us with every aspect of our stay, from river cruises, to dining recommendations, and advice on where to find the best values (and hidden treasures) in Instanbul.  The rooms are clean, the air conditioning is great, and internet is free!  Best of all, they have comfortable deck space overlooking the skyline, including the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus river.  If you stay more than three nights, they'll either pick you up or drop you off at the airport, for free (about a twenty Euro fare per person otherwise).  To give you an understanding of how honest and hospitable the owner is, he offered to pay for our ride back to the airport after one of our other friends had already used…

title: Great location and helpful staff
review: Boutique Apex is a great place to stay for a visit to Istanbul. It is superbly located within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque. Rooms are clean and comfortable. There was wireless internet available. Importantly the staff were the friendliest and most helpful of any of the hotels we stayed at during our trip.

title: Caring staffs, clean, nicely decorated rooms
review: Apex hotel was great.... it is as the photos show. It's situated in a great location to explore Istanbul.The staff are friendly, polite and very helpful.  Free wifi is a great advantage as well. I will recommend this hotel to everybody. :)

title: Why is this hotel so popular?
review: I stayed there for 12nights, thoroughout my entire stay in Istanbul. I stayed with my boyfriend and we had a wonderful stay there. The room is very clean and nicely decorated for a romantic stay. I once returned to the hotel with an upset stomach and the receptionist showed concern of my well-being and called up to my room to ask how I was doing after four hours I returned to the hotel with a pale and ill countenance and even offered a hot drink at the lobby if I need one. The staffs are all very polite and helpful esp the hotel manager Mr. Ibrahim who speaks very good english too. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone even for extended stay.

title: Great Friendly Staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Pleasant Hotel with Accomodating Staff
review: Great hotel.  Great staff, and great location.  The first few nights I was there I had jet lag and cold not sleep. At 4 am, starving to death, I wandered to the lobby to see where I could get some food.  The staff was nice enough to prepare me a plate of food, with juice and water all free of charge.  They did this a few nights (until I ended up being able to sleep on a normal schedule).  They were extremely, extremely nice.  We shopped around for a number of hotels and this one had one of the best prices.  I stayed for a week with my wife.  The location is great.  The rooms are small by North American standards, but average size for European standards.  We ended up staying in a "triple", which has 1 double bed and 1 single.  I would definitely recommend upgrading to this size,…

title: APEX Hotel
review: I booked my stay at the Apex Hotel to spend my last night in Turkey and I could wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for the service alone. I arrived in Istanbul from my excursion in Bodrum early in the morning and on my way to the hotel I ran into the service staff who served breakfast who kindly assisted me with my luggage in one hand as he carried fresh groceries in the other. While they did not have an extra room available for me to do an early check-in, they invited me to their breakfast buffet consisting of various juices, coffee, cheeses, sausages, fruits, etc. and some fresh produce / bread from the local market. A modest breakfast overall and a bit different from the Western breakfasts I am accustomed to, but pleasant nonetheless atop the rooftop terrace.  The room I had…

title: Canadian Viewpoint
review: Spent five wonderful days in Istanbul at APEX Hotel.  Hi to Ibrahim and his staff.  Staff had lots of good ideas for sightseeing and restaruants.  Central location close to all the Sights.  Istanbul was very warm, we found a lovely sea wall walk about five minutes from the hotel - felt about 20 degrees cooler by the ocean!   Great  view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop patio.  Our room was on the third floor facing the street, it was quiet and comfortable.  I recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect holiday
review: The service was excellent begining with check-in and throughout our stay. All the staff were extremely helpful, friendly, and upbeat. They volunteered suggestions and directions as well as educating us on the use the transit alternatives (and when to be alert). Location is excellent (1-2 blocks from the major sites). The room was spacious enough for two staying for 4 nights. Liked the personal service from the Manager and the staff. The breakfast location on the roof worked out as we had very good weather conditions. The breakfast selection was basic but ample. We have already recommended this hotel to others. If you don't frequent the Ritz or Hilton, this is a great place to be.

title: Very nice hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Awesome location, great staff :)
review: I stayed at Apex hotel  in the end of May, 2009. Very nice small  hotel, only 12 numbers.  An  ideal location - 5 minutes walking distance to  historical places of Istanbul.  Bedrooms and bathrooms are not so big, but comfortable, very clean with fresh towels every day. Free wireless Internet is also a nice touch. Breakfast is included  up  on a roof terrace  with an  incredible  view  to Bosporus and the Blue mosque.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  In a hall of hotel always suggested to drink a cup of tea or coffee. I think, that it is very good hotel under quite reasonable price.

title: Cannot see what others see in this hotel
review: Istanbul became one of my favorite cities because of its special atmosphere, numerous world - famous historical sights, delicious cuisine, great music and of course, very friendly people. All in all, city itself is wonderful to explore. :)  As for this hotel, I must say that it was a good choice. It is a nice little hotel with family atmosphere. The best thing about Apex Hotel is its location - in Sultanahmet, so everything that is worth seeing in Istanbul is within a short walking distance. For example it takes just approximatelly 3 (!!) minutes to walk to Blue Mosque, isn't it amazing? :)This hotel is situated quite close to Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Hagia Sophia as well.   Rooms are decorated in a classical Turkish style, they are clean and beds are veeery comfortable…

title: Decent Hotel.  Perfect Location.
review: Firstly let me say that the management and staff are warm, pleasant and do their best for you.  Many thanks to the lovely young man, Tosun I believe, who serves breakfast.  For us, the accommodation was really not up to par, nor was it good value for money.  Our room was dark and cramped.  It was one of 2 on the ground floor.  The lighting was really very deficient within the room.  The floor was extremely uneven to walk on.  The toilet seat, in the bathroom was broken.  The sink leaked over the floor, from its base, perpetually.  The bathroom, like the room was extremely small.  Realising that this situation may have been confined to our particular room, when ascending the stairs to the breakfast room, where there were open doors, we did peer inside to see if there was imprved…

title: A friendly base in the heart of historic Istanbul
review: My wife and I stayed at the Apex Hotel for 3 nights from June 1-4.   When we arrived, we were shown a couple different rooms and were given our choice.  We were shown a decent size room with 3 single beds or a smaller room with 1 double bed.  We choose the one double bed.  The room we had was pretty small.  There was barely enough room to walk around the bed and no space to really put down our suitcases.  I think it all depends on which double room you happen to get though.  My wife said she saw another double room which was being cleaned and she said it was quite a bit bigger than ours.  Also, the shower itself was pretty small and cramped.  The cleanliness of the hotel and the rooms were alright.  The hotel may have recently opened as advertised on their website, but the…

title: Fabulous location, wonderfully friendly staff and a good value too!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: What a lovely owner!
review: We just returned from 4 nights in Istanbul; the last three spent at the Apex Hotel. This hotel is in a great location , so close to everything important to visit in Istanbul. My husband and I were really overwhelmed by the helpful and friendly staff.  They even filled our request for a bucket of ice late at night so we could try some Raki!  Where does THAT happen in Europe? a BUCKET of ICE !   This place is a good value too; the rooms are comfortable with T.V. ( if you really must watch the news) and the rate includes an adequate breakfast on their rooftop terrace. We would absolutely recommend APEX to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

title: We have made a right decission, feel like home.
review: I think I will just be reinforcing what everyone else has said! This is a quirky lovely little hotel slap bang in the middle of all the tourist sites, but down a little (safe) side road, so it is quiet. It is clean, super comfy beds. The breakfasts are fine, but was the one thing that could be improved on. The best bit about Apex is the owner Ibrahim. We had to return to the UK urgently whilst in Istanbul and he could not have been more helpful or kind in what was a difficult  time for us. I doubt very much that the four seasons up the road would have helped us in the way that  the staff at the Apex did. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Apex- we certainly will be should we go to  Istanbul again.

title: Great location and value
review: After we have searched for a lot of hotel in Sultanahmet area, we have read almost all comments in each hotel and finally we selected this hotel only from their high rating and reasonable price for us. We were impressed by their hospitality and helpfulness from Ibrahim (the owner) and his staff which you can asked for their help 24 hours a day. The location was within 5 minutes from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia but in the quiet part of the area. The room we have was clean and airy. The roof top breakfast was breezy with Mamara sea view. We will be there again.

title: Great service and location
review: I stayed at the Apex Hotel from 30 April - 5 May with my brother. The hotel is a quaint small boutique hotel and has real character. If you want 4-5 star this may not be the place for you, but if, like me, you prefer hotels with some "local" character and none of the anonymity of the big chains, this is the place for you. Fantastically friendly and helpful staff who are more than willing to help out with maps, taxis (including free pickup from the airport!) and recommend and book local restaurants/tours, particularly Ibraham who just could not have done more to make our stay a truly wonderful experience. Free wireless Internet is also a nice touch. Rooms and bathroom facilities obviously old and small, but very clean and, once again, full of character and hugely comfortable…

title: Promising little hotel
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location
review: The young manager took charge of the place a couple of months ago and has already improved things. The new terrace on the roof has a view onto the Blue Mosque. While I was there, a kitchen and bar were being built onto the terrace which means farewell to the horrible, fake orange juice and average breakfast and hello to fresh products and food. The rooms are a bit kitsch but I prefer that to cold Heathrow Ibis hotel efficiency.  A very promising place with a dynamic manager.

title: Couldnt be better:)
review: We spent a very enjoyable 4 nights at the Apex Hotel. The location is excellant and the staff friendly and very helpful. The room we had (we were given a choice of 2) was larger than average, with a very comfy bed and a good sized bathroom. Shower was good with plentiful supply of hot water, but some of the other fttings need a little TLC. Toilet roll holder only held in place by one screw, so roll kept falling on to the floor. Hairdryer kept falling out of holder and glass shelf above basin broken at one end. Only small things, but annoying! Breakfast was ok, bread, cold meats, cheese, boiled eggs, jams, fruit etc. Coffee and orange juice could be improved. Basically, the hotel was as described on the Internet and good value for the centre of the Old Town. A little quiet haven…

title: Fantastic location, good value, staff very friendly
review: It may not be the best hotel of stars but i may say that it is the best place that we could stay and the only place we ll stay in the future. Perfect location (walking distance to historical places-sultanahmet-topkapi palace-yerebatan-ayasofya and many more)the friendliest ever and helpfull staff, it was a home away from home... we love u guys and hope to see u again soon.

title: Excellent Location.  Wonderful Staff.  Perfect!  A Must!!!
review: We came here on our honeymoon after a lot of travelling around Europe. We found this hotel to be much nicer than others we stayed at in this price range in Greece and Egypt. A very pleasant, small hotel with atmosphere and very helpful staff who let us use the internet for free and even gave us some Turkish delight and apple tea as a present. Breakfast was boiled eggs, salad, fetta cheese, olives and bread and jam. Location is excellent, a very quiet street but also very close (5 to 10 minutes walk) to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Roman cistern, mosaics museum and Topkapi palace. There are also many restaurants nearby - I recommend Guvec and Ayran at one called Ocean's 7.

title: Safe and Central Location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: EXcellent, clean, friendly staff, close to historical places
review: The best part about this boutique hotel is its location -- near the main attractions and yet quiet and safe. There are several other boutique hotels along the stretch and around the neighborhood and yet, there's a casual and calm feel about the place. This is not a five-star hotel, but the friendliness of the reception staff -- Fikret, Ibrahim, and Yusof -- and the convenient location more than make up for it. The hotel has a family rather than a commercial feel to it. When I checked out, I had some leftover Turkish lira. They allowed me to pay in part in Euro and in part in lira. Because of the conversion, I didn't have the exact amount, and yet, they were so nice to close an eye about it. I would stay here again.

title: Very very nice hotel!
review: Hotel was very clean,comfortable rooms, 24hrs hotwater,sufficient spread breakfast,very friendly staff, arrange your sightseeing arrangements,value for money rates

title: Great location, comfortable bed, friendly staff - ticked all the boxes for me!
review: It is a very nice, cozy and charming hotel directly in the heart of Historical center o the quiet street. Clean rooms decorated Cupidons, terrace with a view on Blue Mosque. Very friendly staff.We will come back to this beautiful hotel in the June!

title: Very good small clean hotel, friendly staff, centrally located (5 minute walt to the Blue Mosque).
review: There are certain things I want from a hotel - location (not necessarily near tourist sites), a comfortable bed that is neither saggy in the middle nor so 'firm' that I bounce and wake up every time my partner shifts an inch) and staff who are just nicely friendly, not rude and not fawning, which is even worse.  And the Apex fits the bill.  It's a casual stroll to the Blue Mosque (which you can see from the breakfast terrace) and on the way you can pop into a bazaar that's a lot smaller than the Grand Bazaar and a lot calmer too.  (Not that there's anything wrong with the buzzy atmosphere of the latter but a respite is welcome too.)  It's taken me so long to get round to this review that I can't remember what the bazaar is called but you can't miss it - turn left out of the…

title: Funny hotel with angel's decoration right in downtown
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: It is very much in the eye of the beholder
review: When we were choosing the hotel, it was about 2 a.m. so it was extremely hard to find something. Finally we opened the fun photoes of Apex hotel with angels over the beds and 32-teeth smiling stuff. We decided to come here to look at them by our own eyes.  So we booked the room and after this minute didn't have any regrets about our choise. Right the next day after the booking, I received the confirmation about it and a question about details of the flight to pick us up in the airport by a free transfer. Actually I liked this moment, because I don't like to call to the hotel by myself to clean up all the details.  The hotel is situated on a very quiet street even if it's really located in the historical center, close to the sea also. A guest manager Yunus gave us a very good…

title: Better than 4 stars, excellent hotel i would recommend .....
review: There have been very many positive reviews about the Apex Hotel Historical with the occasional poor review.  So how can this be? I think with the Apex the impression can very much be in the eye of the beholder and how they feel at the time.  I can see elements of everything that has been described, yet overall I feel that the Apex Historic is a favourable venue for a stay.  Although staying as part of a business trip, I was relaxed, the weather was hot and the sights & smells of Istanbul were intriguing.  In other words I was pleasantly disposed towards my surroundings.  Viewed in this light the hotel was small, attractive & had an air of cosiness and intimacy.  But fact – many of the rooms are small, the shower /toilet in my room was very small, as indeed was my room with the…

title: Perfect friendly family hotel
review: It was first time in istanbul, my wife and i stayed at apex hotel 6 nights, we really enjoyed our stay. Stuff is friendly and always ready to help, room very clean, breakfast was excellent, airport transfer was appreciated, free wireless internet. free tea any time, decor is new, location is fantastic, the guest manager          ( Ibrahim ) is extremely nice, he did his best to make us happy, our flight was 11:30pm , we had to check out 1:00pm, he gave us free room to stay and free drink. If you wanna stay in istanbul go to apex. excellent hotel i would recommend.

title: Weekend in Instanbul
review: From the minute we arrived and received a welcome fruit juice drink & turkish delight we knew we had made the correct choice. We chose this type of hotel because we wanted a  friendly family run hotel. We were not dissapointed. The management are only too happy to help with any request. The rooms are adequate in size with powerful showers. The beds are really comfortable and the quiet street outside, being just 5 minutes walk away from the blue mosque etc, makes it a perfect location.  If you want a  large corporate hotel do not chose this one. If you want small, cosy, comfortable, & friendly this is one of the best we have stayed in and would  strongly recommend it.

title: Exactly as promised
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Excellent!
review: great location, great staff and services, excellent organized pick up and drop off. we will be back to istanbul in fall and will definitely return to the apex hotel

title: the best there is!
review: Me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights in this hotel and I must admit that everything was perfect from the moment they picked up us from the airport (included in the price) until we left with a goodbye gift (!) from the hotel. I have never experienced such incredible service before - nicely furnished and clean room, tasty breakfasts, friendly staff always ready to help with any request. What is also important - this charming hotel is very well located in old Istanbul, just 5 minutes walk from Blue Mosque. I will come back there for sure.

title: I loved staying in this hotel
review: We spend 3 nights in this lovely hotel. After the excellent pick-up from the airprort , we had a  very warm welcome at the hotel. We reserved a double room but they gave us a bigger room for the same price. Good service! The Staff  is friendly and gives very good information and tips. Breakfast was very good, rooms, bathroom are very clean. Rooms are cleaned every day. The hotel is in a very quiet street, so no noise from the street at night and the blue mosque is just around the corner, and all the main atractions are within walking distance..,perfect. Our advice: stop searching  and go to this place, you won't be disappointed. Robert & Yvonne Amsterdam, Holland

title: Friendly and helpful staff!
review: We stayed in this Hotel for our first trip in Istanbul. It was very clean, confortable and quite. The staff was very kind and always tried to help us. They were very helpfull. They can arrange everything for you.  The location is perfect: The hotel is about 2 minutes on foot from the blu Mosquee and Santa Sophia. I strongly reccomend this hotel. Special thanks to the staff for their kindness

title: A Romantic Treat!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Warm welcome, great location
review: My husband and I stayed at the apex for 2 very romantic nights over christmas 2008. We loved the hotel, the staff and especially the room. The hotel is close to the most important sites in the old city area and very clean and well appointed. I would happily recommend it to anybody wishing to find accomodations in Istanbul and the breakfasts are terrific!

title: Clean & Very Friendly Hotel
review: We enjoyed very much our stay at the Apex Hotel. Transfer from the airport to the hotel was organised and worked very well.  Had a very warm welcome up on arrival. Hotel is perfect situated. All major sights are within easy walking distance. Prefered the Sultanahmed area to Taskim, where we stayed last time.  Breakfast was traditional and Ok.  Good value for money! Alex/ Sweden

title: An "Apex Hotel" Honeymoon !!!
review: we stayed at the apex on our first trip to istanbul.  its situated ideally just a couple minutes walk from the blue mosque & aya sofia.  we took advantage of the free pickup from the airport and used their services (at a charge) back to the airport as well.  the hotel is modest and only has 8 rooms total - but clean with all that you need including free wireless. its not the four seasons, so don't expect those types of amenities, nor are you paying for those as the hotel is very reasonably priced.  the staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful in all ways.  i would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a clean and well priced accomodation.

title: Good holidays
review: This review is for people who can understand: Before I book I checked  reviews and  photos of other guests and I decide to go there because of  the location-is my 14th time to Istanbul and I think is 1 of the best areas to stay.  First of all I appreciate the fact that on our arrival,the receptionist show us 2 rooms to choose where we like to stay...!!! (Tell me how many times happen to eveybody without to ask  first...). We choose the 131 room and our first impression was the kitsch decoration the tired furnitures but the room was spacious enough (we booked double room and not a suite!) for the price and turkish standards, clean and with a comfortable mattress, the sheets towels etc were smelling nice the cleaning woman-always with her modest smile change for us EVERY DAY the…

title: My best vacation
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A very good choice
review: We stayed here three days and were completely satisfied with everything. Very friendly staff, cleanliness, quietness, good breakfast and good location, the staff were really helpful , they guide us and informed us what is the best in istanbul. they can arrange every thing for you.

title: Very good experience
review: We stayed here five days and were completely satisfied with everything. Very friendly staff, cleanliness, quietness, good breakfast and excellent location near to the most important points of interest.  At the airport we were picked up and brought to the hotel with a red leather bolstered car, at the hotel we were offered a welcome drink and turkish delight and we could choose from two rooms the one  we liked better. At departure we even received a little present. The people here are really very kind and generous. All in all it was a very good choice and we would come back again.

title: Friendly & well located
review: We asked for an airport pickup and were quoted a price of 25 Euros, which seemed to be in line with what we expected. When they were unable to give us the room that we expected, they comped us the airport pickup, gave us a nice gift and apologized profusely. They gave us good advice about where to dine, didn't try to steer us to a particular restaurant. They were very pleasant and accommodating.  The location is great and we would stay there again.

title: Highly Over Rated / Poor Quality
review: It's 21 years since we last visited Istanbul, though we've been to several other parts of Turkey in recent years, and there's now a vast choice of good hotels (and restaurants) right in the city centre. The Apex came highly recommended on Trip Advisor and in the main lived up to it's billing. We flew into the grossly under-used Sabiha Gokcen airport, which is about 25km's outside Istanbul, and arranged a taxi with the hotel for 50 euro's each way (they agreed to drop their advertised price by 10 euros). We were picked up by a shabby Ford Transit van (a sort of semi-private dolmus really, as we shared with another couple being taken to another hotel) and on arrival were offered a choice between a twin-bedded, dark and quite small room, and a double-bedded room that was so small…

title: Loved the service ,cleanliness and location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Wonderful location/service/room/views
review: We arrived by bus from Burgas, Bulgaria in the evening and took the metro and tram to the Blue Mosque stop and walked to Apex Boutique Hotel. We were met by a very friendly staff member that gave us drinks and turkish delight. Our room was in the back on the 2nd floor, with a view of the Blue Mosque. This hotel is small and quiet, but very friendly, exceptionally clean and the location is the best, within walking distance to all sights. The beds were comfortable. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and answered many questions for us each day. Breakfast was good and filling with fresh bread and many selections of cheese, meat, and salad, juices, coffee and tea. We would recommend this hotel and definately stay here again. Canadian couple 59 years old.

title: Apex need renovation
review: Received warmest of welcomes as we checked in after a dreadful journey! Offered valuable tourist information, maps etc Thought the shower didn't work BUT it is different to home and we had not understood its method. (Perhaps like previous reviewer). It was explained to us and the next 4 days had no problems. Room in vibrant colours was so typically what I imagined Istanbul to be like, I felt like the holiday had begun. Fantastic views from the roof terrace of the Blue Mosque in one direction and the Marmaris in the other. The location was great, 2 mins walk to choice of quiet restaurants, 1 min walk further to restaurants with music and dancing, 1 min walk further Blue Mosque, then busy restaurants noise and bustle, whatever suits you! We travel extensively and this is the first…

title: Great location, excellent service
review: I requested my travel agent to book this hotel based on the reviews below, but I found my stay there was a total disappointment. I booked 2 twin rooms for my friends and i ( 4 pax), but we are only given 1 twin room and 1 double room near the reception area. My travel agent OK this arrangement without first checking with me. Both rooms were extreme small, (especially the double room ),there was barely much space to put our bags. The decoration of the rooms were hideous, too much red in the room, lack of calming effect. They properly want to go for the classical look, but end up looking like a cheap brothel.  Problems with the rooms: Twin rooms *the hairdryer broken. (My friend went to sleep with wet hair) *heater was working *wire with the water heater way too short to reach the…

title: Byzantine, Konstantinopel and Istanbul
review: When I travel, I have very simple requirements : clean and confortable room, good service and great location.  The Apex Hotel in Istanbul offers all that and even more.  I was there for five nights late August.  The room was perfect for me.  And even though my room was on the front side of the hotel, street noise was not an issue.    The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was always served on time on the roof terrace with the Blue Mosque on one side and the Bosphorus on the other.    As for location, you are less than five minutes away from the Blue Mosque and the neighbourhood surrounding the hotel is full of restaurants and bars.  I walked on those streets late at night and I always felt secured.    I would return to the Apex Hotel and I have a feeling that the…

title: One of the amazing surprise during our visit in Istanbul......
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Wonderful area of location and kind staff"
review: Me and my mam had to visit IStanbul second time and we did nt want to stay in previous hotel becouse we didnt like it. We decided to search and choose the hotel in hotels website. And We noticed Apex Hotel and our choice of Apex was only course of its location, HISTORICAL location.  We did nt know what Apex is and decided just to book spontaneously.  And we didnt regret that we booked it! The hotel is very beautiful. The decoration of the hotel is fantastic , the oriental style amazed us. Especially the colors. The rooms are very beautiful and well decoreted, comfortable and home like.  The service is very friendly and kind! We want to say the the service of the HOtel everywhere - reception, housekeeping, restraunt is on the HIGH QUALITY!!! And if we will have chance to visit…

title: Apex very nice small hotel
review: the location of the hotel is wonderful, right in the centre of Instambul in a pretty area. The hotel staff is very kind expecially with children. I really advice the hotel as one of the best accomodation I have had during my travels.

title: Value for money is a problem
review: I stayed at Apex Hotel for one week at the end of July and I strongly recommend this hotel for the exceptional location, the kindness of the staff, the friendly atmosphere and the cleanness of the room. All interesting sites are really at walking distances, the staff and the manager are very helpful and gave us useful information. Small attentions such as the pick up at the arrival, slippers in the room, the tea /drink they always offered us give to this hotel an added value. If, in the future, I 'll have the opportunity to come back to Istanbul, I 'll return in this hotel with the impression to be hosted by friends.

title: I  Was Well Cared For at The Apex
review: Although Apex Hotel is comfortable, value for money is not a strenght of this hotel. The hotel is small, comfortable, clean, has a fantastic location and even some charm. But is also too expensensive for what offers and WC is so small that we couldn't move inside!

title: Highly Recommended
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: such a friendly hotel!
review: We really had a fantastic time at the hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and will go out of their way to assist with any requirements.  The location is fantastic, very close to most of the tourist spots although the morning call is something to get used to!  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Friendly staff
review: Loved staying at the Apex. really friendly and accomodating staff. will definately use the hotel whenever i'm in the city!

title: beautifull terrace
review: Very helpful and friendly staff. Accomodating to our travel arrangements.

title: Apex big disappointment
review: we had a marvelous stays for 3 nights in this small and friendly hotel; the staff was very helpfull; the beds were fine and the proce was reasonable. The hotel is situated in a quiet street, considering it is a quarter of the city that is occupied with tourists. The hotel is an excellent point of starting to dicovever the city and the view from the terrace .... wonderfull. Will certainly book the hotel once again ...

title: Unforgettable!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: We enjoyed our stay. Ozolu family
review: A charming little hotel  in the middle of the ancient part of Istanbul and many of the beautiful sights are only a few minutes’ walk away. The rooms are not too big but very comfortable and nicely air-conditioned. The typical Turkish breakfast at the hotel terrace (on the hotel roof) is a great experience every day because of the breathtaking views of the Sea of Marmara and the Princes Islands. Service is really friendly and they even help you to learn a few Turkish phrases to get along ;-) ... Highly recommendable!

title: Would certainly return
review: The hotel service is simply amazing and very helpful. The staff goes out of their way to make your stay convenient and enjoyable.The location was perfect. The only thing we had to get used to was the singing call to prayer from the nearby mosque, but it  was not  a serious problem. We loved Istanbul and the hotel.

title: Enjoyed the Apex
review: Stayed two days at the Apex Hotel and had a great experience there! Correspondence with the staff prior to arrival was efficiently answered. Staff was very helpful and willing to assist with all our arrangements (airport transfer, late checkout, etc). Breakfast buffet was a nice experience with the backdrop of the Blue Mosque. Rooms were exceptionally clean. The manager have us a gift of Turkish apple tea with glasses and a front desk staff member gave us free postcards of Turkey! Would definitely return again. :)

title: Apex Istanbul
review: We stayed at the hotel for a short time and the staff treated us like royalty.  They even served breakfast to us at 2:30 AM as we had an ungodly early flight to catch.  The location was conveniently close to the “must see sights”.  I recommend  the Apex highly.

title: istanbul perfect at the apex!!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great little gem in Istanbul !
review: It is incredible to stay in a place for few days and feel like home.  My parents staid at the hotel and they told me it was absolutely fantastic. The location absolutely incredible!!! It was my mother's birthday and the trip was her present. The hotel arranged a rose and a cake on the date which made my mother nearly crying. I personaly asked for a rose to be found at breakfast and that I would have paid myself. It was a present from the hotel!!!! and on top of this and the free transfer from the airport my mother and her friend received a welcoming present! My parents told me it was so clean and so perfect and the people so nice that they would tell everyone looking for accomodation to go there. I personally hope to visit istanbul very soon and will definitely stay at the apex.…

title: our romantic week together
review: We spent a long weekend in Istabul at the Apex, the city in itself was lovely - but the stay at Apex really made our weekend.  Rooms are nice (we stayed in 134 a fairly large room with a clean but small bathroom.)  The breakfast is not much to cheer about, quite boring actually.  However the staff were wonderful - they really made that extra effort in making us feel welcome and at home.   Location is perfect - especially if this is your first visit to Istanbul, close range to the "must see sights". And also just a few minutes walk to the tram to take you to Beygolu (for night life).  We can really recommend a stay at the Apex !!

title: Fantastic
review: me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel for 7 days and it was the best 7 days of my life the staff were very freindly and kind the breakfast was lovely and our room was always clean the staff explained to us the beautifull parts of the city i dont speak very good turkish but the comunication was very good the last night i was there the staff were very helpfull because i was ill but my girlfreind did a very perfect job of looking after me i love her to bits we really had an amazing time and in october we are thinking of staying there again because we are planning to get married i hope we get the same room :)

title: Highly Recommended
review: I visit Istanbul four times a year and have never found a Hotel to return to until now....I was greeted at the Airport in a beautiful car with leather interior the driver was very helpful and polite and genuinely pleased to see me, when I reached the Hotel I was greeted with a non alcoholic cocktail which was much appreciated and Harun the Manager helped me to settle in and was most helpful. The Hotel was immaculate I could see this straight away my room was just lovely, I noticed tea and coffee makingfacilities which Ihave never been offered in Istanbul Hotels before and a lovely well equipped bathroom and courtesy slippers for myself and my boyfriend, just little touches but you really felt like one of the family straightaway! My boyfriend was working most days and ordering…

title: What a great find.
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Perfect stay!
review: We ended our cruise in Istanbul.  Knowing that we'd have already spent a fortune, I needed to find something nice, but inexpensive.  I found the Apex on Trip Advisor.    What a gem this was for us.  It was the best price by at least 100 euros compared to any other hotel, yet no other hotel has perfect reviews.  For this price, employee friendliness, and central location - you will not do better than this place.  The Apex is in the same area as the 4-Seasons resort - this is a very nice area with old, restored buildings.  The streets are made from bricks.  Not only are all the main attractions within 5 minutes walk, but there are shops, restaurants, and pubs right around the corner.   This is a super little hotel, located in a very nice neighborhood, with everything close by.  …

title: Four wonderful days in Istanbul
review: Our stay in the Apex Hotel was just perfect. We appreciated a lot the warm welcome and nice explanation about the hotel and Istanbul in general. The rooms are lovely decorated and very clean. We stayed in a room in the back which was very quiet but I think the front rooms are also nice because the hotel is located in a very quiet street. Just around the corner there are some very nice restaurants and shops and the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi palace are only a 5 minutes walk! A pity that they were working on the roof terrace but the breakfast downstairs was also nice (French bread, cheese, salami, marmelades, honey, tea, coffee, olives, eggs,...). A special plus for this hotel is the friendliness of the staff. All of them were always very helpfull and friendly.

title: Wonderful pace to stay in the remarkable city of Istanbul
review: We have just returned home after four wonderful days in Istanbul. Our stay there was truly memorable due mainly to the hospitaly shown to us by Harun and his staff at Apex Hotel Historical. All the staff were friendly and courteous at all times. We were a group of four people, a German couple and ourselves, an Irish couple. The staff were able to converse in both english and german.      Apex Hotel is ideally located -- a few minutes walk from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Basilica Cistern. We had no need for public transport or taxis.   Bedrooms were very comfortable, by day 4 we actually slept through the early morning call to prayer from the Blue Mosque !!!  Michael Mary Cox Ireland

title: Just the Best - from the USA
review: We booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews we had read in Trip Advisor and we were very glad we did.  Our plane was 1 ½ hours late and when we arrived the manager was waiting for us, all smiles, there was no problem that we were late and kept him waiting.  He whisked us off to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel there was a welcome drink and Turkish delight. A very nice start!!  The location of this hotel is ideal, very central to all the stunning attractions of Istanbul.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and made you feel very welcome at all times. After a day of sight seeing you were always welcomed with a smile and it was no problem for them to make you a tea or coffee. Nothing was too much trouble.  The room was very spacious and comfortable and there…

title: Istanbul, The Blue Eye City
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: great position
review: A very comfortable and peaceful hotel in the heart of historical area of Sultanahmet. It's amazing the way we have been welcomed in Turkey by Hotel staff: a transfer from Ataturk airport to Apex hotel on a new Mercedes offered by Mr Harun Cadirci (Hotel General Manager), a welcome drink with a taste of typical Turkish sweets at our arrival, little briefing on Istanbul best attractions with informations about distances and means of transport given by desk clerk (all guys are very good, always smiling and helpful). The rooms are well equipped, with much space between bed and bath, kept tidy.... towels changed everyday, minibar, TV... The first reason why everybody should choose Apex Hotel? Because it is 5 minutes walking from the most important beauties.... and it's situated in a…

title: Fantastic staff
review: Just returned from a 5 nite stay at the 'Apex hotel - the best thing about this hotel is the position - right in the middle of the Sultanhammet area,  also the  service the staff give you is a big plus.    The Apex is a small hotel, it has no bar altho the staff are so helpful they will purchase wine or beer for you if you require it - the roof terrace wasnt  quite ready for guests whilst I was there, but you can still use it - it has a good view - the rooms are very clean, and some larger than others - all with showers - breakfast is served downstairs and is simple but plentiful - the apple tea is great, I would recommend this small boutique hotel if you are looking for a good value base.

title: In the heart of Sultanahmet
review: Stayed here for five night. Brilliant position - easy walking distance to best sites but staff willing to arrange transport for you if you don't want to walk. Rooms were quite small but very clean. Breakfast was fine. Roof terrace wasn't finished with renovation but we were still able to use it. There is no drinks licence but ideal for being able to take our own duty frees on the roof terrace and having an evening drink. Staff were more than happy to bring us up ice and glasses. In fact the staff were the best we have ever encountered on any holiday, very friendly, helpful and polite. Brilliant. Would recommend the Apex to any one. Very inexpensive. From Jim & Jo Richards, Devon, England.

title: gentle
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice place on walking distance of great highlites and good restaurants
review: The hotel is situated in the middle of Sultanahmet (blue mosque ect) The rooms are very nice and the showers excellent. Every day we came back in a very clean room. The staff was helpfull, friendly and always wanted to make a small talk. In the morning you can have breakfast at the roof terrace. The breakfast is simple but there is enough choice and the bread was really fresh.All four of us enjoyed staying here and for sure we will come back again.

title: Excellent service and location!
review: We stayed for 4 nights to visit Istanbul. (As firsttimers) We particularly liked the VIP Airportshuttle, wich took us without any delay within 30 minutes to the hotel. On arrival we were offered a drink. Check in only took seconds. Staff were very nice,polite etc. But it seemed that they really wanted us to have a good time. Breakfast was simple, but sufficient. The room offered everything needed. The bed slept very well. Real value for money. In walking distance not only Blue Mosc, Aya Sofia, Cisternes and Topkapi palace, but also a nice range of restaurants.

title: apex
review: Besides excellent location in the very heart of old Istanbul (few minutes apart from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia), hotel Apex Historical offers first rate service, and its very kind and pleasant personnel made our stay enjoyable during entire week - from the welcome cocktail to the farewell gift. Next time I visit Istanbul (and I hope it will be soon) I will know which hotel to book without Internet search :)

title: Homely hotel!
review: Me and my wife just arrived from Istanbul where we stayed in this lovely hotel. The hotel is small (12 rooms) but very nice. On the arrival we were picked up up from the airport by hotel's free shuttle. No problems at all. All the staff was very frienly. The room where we spent 3 nights was big. We really enjoyed being there. 5 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and Aisophia. Very quiet. Thanks to all the staff again. Valery & Marina Lushchenko, Moscow, Russia.

title: There is no friendlier hotel on this planet!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Charming little Hotel with great location
review: I'm just back from Istanbul, where my friends and I stayed at The Apex Hotel in the Sultanahmet area of the city. We stayed 3 nights in this hotel, which is in a quiet back-street, only 2 minutes from the Blue Mosque, and 3 to 5 minutes away from Ayasofia, the Roman Cistern, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. The Ferries to the Asian side of Istanbul are only a 10 minute walk as well, so you can imagine how centrally located it is! The most impressive part of the Apex though, has got to be the owners and the staff. If you book for 3 nights or more, they will pick you up at the Airport free of charge as they did us. We walked out of the baggage area and they were waiting with a board with our name on it and whisked us away to the hotel, a journey of some 20 minutes or so. The…

title: Marvelous place
review: I just came back from Istanbul where i spent the Easter weekend. We stayed at the Hotel Apex boutique hotel, which is tucked away in a quiet street in Sulthanamet. On arrival, we were offered a local cocktail. The hotel is clean, quite basic but the beds were very comfortable and we had a very nice bathroom. The staff was very friendly, helpful and welcoming. There is a nice view from the terrasse. The breakfast is basic (cheese, yoghurt, tomatoes, bread, jam and honey and a couple of thypes of cereal). Great location, we were only few minutes away from the Agia Sophia and the blue Mosque. Would definately recommend for people to stay at this hotel. It was also very cheap 70GBP per night for a double room.  A quick note on Istanbul: sultanamhet is very expensive (coffee 3GBP,…

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: My recipe for spending good time on ur holidays... Firstly, choose Istanbul - amazing city, second - find a comfortable place to stay.   If you are here, being confused and asking yourself:  "Which hotel i should choose?"; searching for good location, pleasant atmosphere, nice staff?? As well as cosy rooms and delicious breakfast??   Hmm..I can recommend you The Apex Hotel!:) Here you will find everything what you are looking for. Great location - in Sultanahmet, so everything what is worth to see (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Yerebatan Sarnici, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar etc.) is in walking distance from this accomodation. Personnel is very friendly and helpful. Thanks to  them the atmosphere is warm and welcoming every time. Also furnishings make it very cosy.  It was my choice…

title: Lovely Apex in Istanbul
review: We are two couples and stayed three nights at this beautiful hotel. We have to say that the hotel has very good hospitality, nice and friendly staff and it is very clean. Also we all loved its style and decoration.  The hotel is very close to Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi so you enjoy walking inside old town, visiting the above. There are also near some nice shops with souvenirs and cafes with nargile and tea. Very close to tram stop for the city. Anything you want the staff is always willing to give you information.

title: FABULOUS!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm.
